item.title: EY identifies obstacles that are impeding the effectiveness of the AEC
item.description: Political, legal, and organizational difficulties, regulatory burdens, and a lack of standardized trade regulations among ASEAN nations are hindering the progress of the 2007 ASEAN Economic Community (AEC) Blueprint. This plan aims to achieve regional economic integration by 2015, according to EY. A recent EY report, “Trade Secrets: ASEAN economic community and inward investment,” examines the AEC’s development from a business standpoint, specifically focusing on obstacles to conducting business within ASEAN.

item.title: Air China has initiated a codeshare agreement with China Express
item.description: Air China, the national airline of China and a major carrier between China and Europe/US, has partnered with China Express, a regional airline based in Guiyang, starting September 1st. Air China’s network covers 162 destinations across 32 countries and regions. Source: Air China. The agreement was formalized in Guiyang, Guizhou on August 29, 2014. This agreement will link the cities of Chongqing, Guiyang, and Dalian through the airlines’ networks. Air China already operates over 50 routes to these areas, including most Chinese provincial capitals.
